alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 8:52AM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Extreme Fire Conditions Expected Again Today... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EXTREME FIRE CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF EASTERN IOWA, NORTHWEST ILLINOIS AND NORTHEAST MISSOURI... * TIMING...11 AM to 8 PM CDT. * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 21 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires will spread rapidly and be very difficult to control in these dangerous conditions. Outdoor burning should be avoided.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
